Replies.Reply: Nearly missed it!
Hey. Are you doing the east pike?
I'm on my own. I'm Aron.
Nice to meet you. What a day.
Did you bike or come straight from the trail head?
I left mine at the Horseshoe Canyon and biked here.
17 and windy.
I do this a lot.
Wasn't expecting to see anyone in the canyon today.
Sorry.
Yeah, I know, I mean there's no one around for 50 miles.
Let me guess... You're here for the paintings or the Cathedral?
The climb's a little tricky but it's worth it.

There's thousands of holds but you can't see them until you're almost upside down and then they just keep appearing... it's a bit of a act of faith so I'll go first... take off as much as you dare as there's a bit of a surprise at the other end...
I swear I won't look but I swear you won't care when you get out here...
... and the thing is, when you get to the middle...
... there aren't any more.
Well, there's not really anyone special.
Long story.
I've done 46 of the 59 winter solo ascents.
Well I figure no one else is mad enough to climb in the winter.
What? No.
Just like a MOTEL 6 then?
Solitude. Great tunes. Empty mind.
And I can sing Phish songs as loud as I like.
Yeah, I know, I know.
See, that's why I'm on my own.
I'll get this. Leave no trace.
Hey, but I like a beer like the next man. You know, end of the day.
I'm not certified yet but that's what I want to do.
Great. Now put your ass on my head.
You'll have to chimney down a little ways - like here, watch -
Why don't you come with me to the Big Drop Rappel? I can give you a lift back to your car.
About another 8 miles or so, I think.
No, I really got to do this. Anyway I've my miner's lamp.
No, it's great for seeing snakes in hand holds. Can I get a picture then?
Listen, my friends are having a party tomorrow night. You should come.
Drive on the east road and about 40 miles out there's a huge inflatable Scooby Doo. You can't miss it.
No, I really got to do this.
That's the one. I'll have 3 cold beers waiting for us.
Easy Aron, easy now.
Won't be coming back this way.
Yep.
FUCK, get your hand out of there!
SHIT, SHIT, SHIT, SHIT...
YEEARKGG... UNNNHHH   Air exploding out of his lungs. And then a quiet hollow sound of the boulder shifting fractionally. A howl of phenomenal pain -
NO, NO, NO, NO, FUCK.
No, no... more water.
Relax. Stop. Come on.
FUCK! What the fuck? How the fuck did you get your hand trapped by a fucking boulder? Its crushed, it's fucking dying man!
HELP! HELLO!
Not good.
When in a hole....
Fuck. It's hard as iron.
NO, NO!
Shit!
Shit!!!
Sweet.
Cool.
Aahhhhh.
Caw-caw.

It's three-oh-five on Sunday. This marks my twenty-four-hour mark of being stuck in Blue John Canyon above the Big Drop. My name is Aron Ralston. My parents are Donna and Larry Ralston of Englewood, Colorado. Whoever finds this, please make an attempt to get this to them. Be sure of it. I would appreciate it.
So... I was hiking Blue John Canyon yesterday... and this happened.
What you're looking at there is my arm, going into the rock... and there it is, stuck. It's been without circulation for 24 hours.
It's pretty well gone. If the colour doesn't come across on the video, it's grey and blue.
Unnhhhhh.......I'm in deep stuff.
So I have very little water.
Yeah, I have about a third of a litre left.

So the way I see it... there's kind of four things happening here... I tried to move it with some rigging... useless... and I tried chipping away at the rock... I think part of the problem is, is that my hand is actually supporting the rock. Which means every time I chip away the rock moves a bit and settles onto my hand again. I can't feel it happening but microscopically, it seems to be, because the little gap over there between the rock and the wall seems to be getting smaller. And this chockstone is the hardest thing here.
So the third thing left was to cut my arm off.
I don't know whether I could do that but it's pretty much suicide.
Which means I'm waiting for someone to come along.
I didn't tell anyone where I was going and I didn't leave a note on the truck.
Dumb.
HELP!!! HELP!!!! OVER HERE!!!
No one's coming Aron.
God, I am praying to you for guidance. I'm trapped in Blue John Canyon - you probably know that -
OK, then, God, since you're apparently busy: Devil, if you're listening, I need some help here.
Ungg-gggu-ggga-gggngh!
Yeah. Not very funny.
Still not sure. I'll see you Tuesday.
Always do.
It's Monday - all day - bummer. I spent the morning trying to create a 6:1 system ration and lift the boulder but friction between the rope and carabiners is dissipating every bit of force I apply.
All it's good for is sitting in...

I have about one hundred and fifty millilitres of water left. That's four ounces. I can't believe it but I peed twice today, within a few minutes of each other. How is this possible? It's two days since I peed, I'm dehydrated and I had to go so quickly I forgot to save the first. I saved the second in the CamelBak. Will I drink it? It smells foul, and hot but it'll settle. And I can chill it in the sand in the night. It's like Polar winter here for nine hours.
No number twos. Which will disappoint my insect friends.

I keep chipping at the rock but just to generate warmth and give me something to do. I think it's making it worse. I know it's settling more on my arm as I remove material from it. The area where I chipped flakes off yesterday has already rotated down onto my arm.
Oh yeah. That aches.
Shit!
Pathetic, Aron, pathetic.
The blades are too blunt even to break the skin. I guess that's the chipping. It's not even a proper Leatherman. It's a knock-off one we got free in a gift pack with a torch... Mom gave it to me.

I didn't get to hear firsthand how your championships went, but I heard from Mom that you placed very well at the national competitions, that you were tenth overall in speech and debate in the nation.
I can imagine you in your living room looking back at me.
I've been thinking about what my friend Rob in Aspen says to me several... frequently.. Several times that, confusingly, 'It's not what you do but who you are'.
It's cold... this place is an ice-
" - to do all the outings that I did". PAUSE.
Replies.Didascalie: (CONT'D) (he struggles to complete the sense of the  SENTENCE)

Replies.Reply: I did want to say, on the logistical side of things, I have some American Express insurance that should cover costs of the recovery operation when that does happen. Bank account balances should take care of my credit-card debts. You'll have to sell my house, Mom and Dad. Possession-
No. No. Don't.
See you later...
Fuck a nut, Aron. Pay fucking attention - look what you did?
Good morning everyone! It's 6:45 Tuesday morning in BJ Canyon. The weather is great! I figure by now that Leona, my housemate - Hi Leona! - has missed me hopefully since I didn't show up last night.
Mom, Dad, I really love you guys.
I really have lived this last year.
Ready for lift-off.
Come on, move, dammit.
Whoa, that's the bone.
Ouch!
This next part may not be for all viewers at home. It's a little after eight. At precisely eight o'clock I took my last sip of clean water... and... hide your eyes, Mom...
I made an attempt - a short career in surgery, as it turned out -
Shit missed it. 8:31AM. He's late and I still missed it.
God, it's Aron again. I still need some help. It's getting bad here.
Out of date. May Day. Not dead.
There was a little boy,and he looked like my cousin Charlie but he was too young. And I don't want to die... But I really don't know what to do.
I hate this rock.
I hate it.
I hate this fucking canyon.
I hate this cold slab pressing me against this damp fucking wall.
I know there's water near coz of these fucking mosquitoes.
I hate this fucking mess.
Shit.
Ok Aron, here we go. You're in it now.
AAAAARRRRRGGGGHHHH!
I AM NOT GOING TO DIE.... HERE.
Replies.Didascalie: (spitting out this declaration at the rock)

Replies.Reply: HELP!
HELP ME! I NEED HELP!
Hang in there Aron.

My name is Aron Ralston. I was trapped by a boulder on Saturday and I've been without food and water for 5 days. I cut my arm off this morning to get free and I've lost a lot of blood. I need medical attention.
No, we need to keep hiking.
Who? Who told you?
Do you have a phone?
Do you have a cell phone?
Is it ok for me to drink so much water?
I gotta stop and empty my shoes.
Yes I am. Can I get a lift?
I'm gonna make a terrible mess of your seat.
Thank you for bringing me back.
Will you look after this for me please?
Mom.
Hey Mom.
OK. Are you okay...
Mom, I'm sorry I scared you.
So are you guys ok with me?
Christine told me.
Yeah.
I'm gonna finish the 49ers this winter or next.
Rana, before I did it I was hallucinating, I saw this child, a little blond boy -
No, he looked like my cousin Charlie but way too young... and I didn't know why but I knew he was mine and that this was what lay in front of me.
But it's not going to be you, is it?
OK.
Sure, I'm Kristi.
It's beautiful.
We left the car there. Pretty quiet.
minute, why is he wearing a HOCKEY  MASK!' They all laugh.
The Cathedral? We've got a bit disorientated and the map isn't great. Where is it?
OMG!
Of course he's ok. Listen to him.
Got to be there, Meg.
So have you got a girlfriend, Aron?
There's always a girl, you just don't know it yet.
With lots of characters in it.
... you can be the highest person on the continent!
Why are you on your own?
Not those guys from...
Well, we'll sign your time-card today.
Okay but don't look and no grabbing now, if I do...
Shhh!
How far is it?
Yeah, we'd like that. What time?
Come on Aron, hike out with us -
Okay. Scooby Doo, yeah?
Megan.
You biked from Horseshoe? That's 20 miles or more.
Yeah, you surprised us, sneaking up like that.
It's kind of nervy seeing a lone guy walking up to you in the middle of the desert.
You behave Aron Ralston or we'll tell your mother all about where you lure girls...
Are you ok? ARON!
We've got to go again. And film it!
I really can't eat all this chocolate by myself... Never mind, yes I can!
Ah, so there's lots of girlfriends.
Yeah, we meet lots of guys and there's always a girl.
Wow, highest person in Colorado.
Didn't you see it?
Yeah, it's an old cattle guardian's house - the roof's caved in and someone spray-painted MOTEL 6 on the side. Smelled weird though.
Phish?
An illegal instructor.
Oh whatever, you love it.
I didn't understand any of that.
Kristi, I think this is our way back.
You'll never get out before dark.
You don't climb at night, do you?
Where?
12 cold beers!
Good evening Las Vegas... are you having a good time? Are you ready for PHISH!
He snaps the log now arching above him well out of reach.
Wow, look at the size of this one.
How the fuck did this get there?
Caw-caw.
OK - lights off and line up alongside me.
On the other side of this line, everything will be different.
And remember, stick together, the desert wants to kill you.
Yeah. We split up a while back when you were in hospital.
Is that what this is about?
What about the climbing?
Solo?
Well, all I can't figure out is what took you so long to cut it off and get one of these.
Not Jesus please...
No Aron, it's not.
You know, everyone who cares for you, a little bit of them dies each time you go back.
Let's go hero. If they do The Fly first and we miss it we'll never be forgiven.
Still, I'd get a drink.
I'm really fucked now. I'm out of water.
Aron, it's Mom. Hoping to catch you. Nothing urgent. Dad's in New York so it'll be a quiet weekend.
That was your Mom! And your Dad called. Call him. We're going.
Now real pain in his right arm. Weird smile at the success.
There's water, joy, 2 beautiful girls, happiness, sensuality, company, freedom...
A figure starts body with a a small fire to furious comfort Aron. vengeance.
bit off. Masticates it on I'm on the and on... Chewing. urine diet now. Well, The chockstone it's no waits and Aron's slurpee...' foot kicks and then lands and they fall together.
away desultory A slit of light in blackness reveals Jon in work clothes.
Rana's face is remaining in huge on the inside the light.An of his head bag, smiling accelerating at him. Her face in huge carousel of scale compared to his head. yellow warmth.
I did this Aron. I created this.
...his love, the peace that passeth all understanding...
...his love, the peace that passeth all understanding...
Like a gunshot in the canyon, the bone breaks. The sound ricochets. He rises and sees the bone pushing up violently against the skin. He feels it. It's a serrated, but clean, successful break.
A second gun shot smashes around the canyon. He's sweating heavily and yet euphoric, possessed. He checks the underneath of the arm. It's broken too. Around the same place.

We are the Mejers from Holland. At the start of the trailhead we talked to a ranger who told us about a car that was parked in the area already for several days and that the owner might be missing in the canyon. We joked that we would keep our eyes open and that we would try to find him.
We didn't find him, he found us!
We are the Mejers from Holland.
They told us you were here.
There's no signal for miles.
No. I'm Wayne. I have some medical training.
Sure so long as it doesn't make you vomit.
Make sure he doesn't pass out.
Are you Aron?
Just get in buddy. We're all looking for you.
That's all your miracle days used up kid. You need to rest. You can stand everyone a beer later.
My boy. My only one. There you are.
How are you feeling?
You've been asleep for 2 days. We are so lucky...
